Robert A. Warder, Rapid City, S.D., for defendant.

MEMORANDUM OPINION
DONALD J. PORTER, District Judge.
Creditor Gregor appeals the decision of the United States Bankruptcy Court discharging *1021 a judgment debt against debtor Ertz. The judgment was rendered in state court against Ertz for an assault and battery against Gregor in which Gregor sustained bodily injuries. The state court awarded compensatory damages to Gregor but refused his request for exemplary damages. The issue presented is whether this refusal constituted a finding by the state court that the injuries inflicted by Ertz were not willful and malicious for the purposes of the Bankruptcy Code. If they were not, the debt is dischargeable by the bankruptcy court under 11 U.S.C. § 523(a)(6).[1]
